definitions.definition: a narrow strip of material, typically used to hold or fasten something.
long narrow flexible material with magnetic properties, used for recording sound, pictures, or computer data.
a cassette or reel containing recorded material.
examples: audiocassette/videocassette, (a) reel, (a) spool; Morevideo, VHS "they recorded the interview on tape"Morevideo, VHS they recorded the interview on tape

definitions.definition: a recording on a cassette or reel.
a strip of paper or plastic coated with adhesive, used to stick things together.
examples: noun: adhesive tape; plural noun: adhesive tapes
synonyms: duct tape; trademarkScotch Tape "secure the bandage with tape"

definitions.definition: a strip of material stretched across the finish line of a race, to be broken by the winner.
a strip of white material at the top of a tennis net.
a strip of material used to mark off an area.
record (sound or pictures) on audio or videotape.
examples: it is not known who taped the conversation
synonyms: capture on tape; video "police taped his confession"

definitions.definition: fasten or attach (something) with adhesive tape.
examples: bind, stick, fix, fasten, secure, attach; Moretie, strap "a card was taped to the box"Moretie, strap a card was taped to the box

definitions.definition: seal or mark off an area or thing with tape.
examples: cordon (off), seal (off), close (off), shut (off), mark (off), fence (off); Moreisolate, segregate "they taped off the area"Moreisolate, segregate they taped off the area
